definition: to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: As it is mainly for goods transportation the interior seems lousy.
sentences.chinese: 而基于它主要用作运送货物，内宠就显得凌乱。

sentences.english: The teacher harangued us all about our untidy work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对于凌乱的作业对我们全部喋喋不休地训斥。

sentences.english: Iv He had uncombed hair, dirty clothes, and only 35 cents in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他头发凌乱，衣衫肮脏，口袋里仅有35美分。

sentences.english: Messy stuffs will distract ones attention and affect studying mood.
sentences.chinese: 东西凌乱会分散注意力，也会影响学习情绪。

sentences.english: A request, crushed and broken by your self-esteem, demeaning them behind.
sentences.chinese: 一句句请求，破碎凌乱的自尊，被你辚轹在身后。

sentences.english: I met her in a small, untidy coffeehouse on the outskirts of London.
sentences.chinese: 我是在伦敦郊外的一个狭小凌乱的咖啡馆遇见她的。

sentences.english: During the owners' absence the lawn became dreadfully unkempt .
sentences.chinese: 主人们不在的时候，草地变得凌乱不堪。

sentences.english: How can you find your files when your desk is so messy ?
sentences.chinese: 你的书桌这么凌乱，你要怎么找到你的档案夹呢？

sentences.english: His life began to be disorder. Everyday job was to find a job.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活开始凌乱不堪，每天的工作就是找工作。

sentences.english: This room seems always to be in a clutter.
sentences.chinese: 这个房间总是凌乱不堪。

sentences.english: A disheveled pile of books on the library table.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的桌子上摆着一堆凌乱不整的书。

sentences.english: Look at the rain, messy hair, wet clothes.
sentences.chinese: 看疏雨，凌乱着发鬓，湿了衣襟。

sentences.english: The room was in a state of disorder.
He had uncombed hair , and dirty clothes .
He sat down on his unmade bed and looked at the mini bar.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在凌乱的床上，盯着房间里的迷你吧台。

definition: disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
in a mess/scattered about/in complete disorder
